article.headline: Fairfield 72, American U. 56
article.story: WASHINGTON, D.C. -- Yorel Dawkins scored 18 points as Fairfield overcame a two-point halftime deficit to cruise past winless American University 72-56 on Monday night. Derek Needham scored 13 points, Mike Evanovich had 11 and Lyndon Jordan added 10 for the Stags (3-1), who outscored the Eagles 45-27 in the second half to seal the win. Leading 45-42 with 9:57 left, Fairfield went on a 16-4 run in just over 5 minutes to take control of the game. Jordan hit a pair of 3s to fuel the spree. Nick Hendra and Stephen Lumpkins scored 14 points apiece to pace the Eagles (0-5). American outrebounded Fairfield 37-27, but turned the ball over 20 times compared to just eight for the Stags. Fairfield was 11-for-15 from the free-throw line, while American hit just 5 of 13 foul shots.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
